trans-unit.source: Monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs with PowerShell | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs with PowerShell | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure PowerShell and cmdlets to monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure PowerShell and cmdlets to monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: Monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs with Azure PowerShell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Monitor and manage Stream Analytics jobs with Azure PowerShell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Learn how to monitor and manage Stream Analytics resources with Azure PowerShell cmdlets that execute basic Stream Analytics tasks.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to monitor and manage Stream Analytics resources with Azure PowerShell cmdlets that execute basic Stream Analytics tasks.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for running Azure PowerShell cmdlets for Stream Analytics
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for running Azure PowerShell cmdlets for Stream Analytics

trans-unit.source: Install and configure Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Install and configure Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install] to install Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell][powershell-install] to install Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To connect to your Azure subscription by using the Azure Active Directory method:
trans-unit.target: To connect to your Azure subscription by using the Azure Active Directory method:

trans-unit.source: To select your Azure subscription with the Azure Stream Analytics service enabled use the method:
trans-unit.target: To select your Azure subscription with the Azure Stream Analytics service enabled use the method:

trans-unit.source: Configure the Azure mode.
trans-unit.target: Configure the Azure mode.

trans-unit.source: After installing Azure PowerShell, run the [Switch-AzureMode][msdn-switch-azuremode] cmdlet to set the appropriate Azure mode to access Stream Analytics cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: After installing Azure PowerShell, run the [Switch-AzureMode][msdn-switch-azuremode] cmdlet to set the appropriate Azure mode to access Stream Analytics cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Stream Analytics jobs created programmatically do not have monitoring enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Stream Analytics jobs created programmatically do not have monitoring enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: You can manually enable monitoring in the Azure Portal by navigating to the job’s Monitor page and clicking the Enable button or you can do this programmatically by following the steps located at [Azure Stream Analytics - Monitor Stream Analytics Jobs Programatically](stream-analytics-monitor-jobs.md)
trans-unit.target: You can manually enable monitoring in the Azure Portal by navigating to the job’s Monitor page and clicking the Enable button or you can do this programmatically by following the steps located at [Azure Stream Analytics - Monitor Stream Analytics Jobs Programatically](stream-analytics-monitor-jobs.md)

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell cmdlets for Stream Analytics
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell cmdlets for Stream Analytics

trans-unit.source: The following Azure PowerShell cmdlets can be used to monitor and manage Azure Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: The following Azure PowerShell cmdlets can be used to monitor and manage Azure Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob

trans-unit.source: Lists all Stream Analytics jobs defined in the Azure subscription or specified resource group, or gets job information about a specific job within a resource group.
trans-unit.target: Lists all Stream Analytics jobs defined in the Azure subscription or specified resource group, or gets job information about a specific job within a resource group.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-Central-US.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about all the Stream Analytics jobs in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-Central-US.

trans-unit.source: Example 3
trans-unit.target: Example 3

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the Stream Analytics job StreamingJob in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-Central-US.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the Stream Analytics job StreamingJob in the resource group StreamAnalytics-Default-Central-US.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput

trans-unit.source: Lists all of the inputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job, or gets information about a specific input.
trans-unit.target: Lists all of the inputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job, or gets information about a specific input.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about all the inputs defined in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about all the inputs defined in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the input named EntryStream defined in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the input named EntryStream defined in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput

trans-unit.source: Lists all of the outputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job, or gets information about a specific output.
trans-unit.target: Lists all of the outputs that are defined in a specified Stream Analytics job, or gets information about a specific output.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the outputs defined in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the outputs defined in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the output named Output defined in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the output named Output defined in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsQuota
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsQuota

trans-unit.source: Gets information about the quota of streaming units in a specified region.
trans-unit.target: Gets information about the quota of streaming units in a specified region.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the quota and usage of streaming units in the Central US region.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the quota and usage of streaming units in the Central US region.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation

trans-unit.source: Gets information about a specific transformation defined in a Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: Gets information about a specific transformation defined in a Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command returns information about the transformation called StreamingJob in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command returns information about the transformation called StreamingJob in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput
trans-unit.target: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput

trans-unit.source: Creates a new input within a Stream Analytics job, or updates an existing specified input.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new input within a Stream Analytics job, or updates an existing specified input.

trans-unit.source: The name of the input can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.
trans-unit.target: The name of the input can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.

trans-unit.source: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.
trans-unit.target: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an input that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing input.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an input that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing input.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing input name, the input will be replaced without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing input name, the input will be replaced without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Input (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-input] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Input (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-input] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command creates a new input from the file Input.json.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command creates a new input from the file Input.json.

trans-unit.source: If an existing input with the name specified in the input definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
trans-unit.target: If an existing input with the name specified in the input definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command creates a new input in the job called EntryStream.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command creates a new input in the job called EntryStream.

trans-unit.source: If an existing input with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
trans-unit.target: If an existing input with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

trans-unit.source: Example 3
trans-unit.target: Example 3

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command replaces the definition of the existing input source called EntryStream with the definition from the file.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command replaces the definition of the existing input source called EntryStream with the definition from the file.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob
trans-unit.target: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob

trans-unit.source: Creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure, or updates the definition of an existing specified job.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure, or updates the definition of an existing specified job.

trans-unit.source: The name of the job can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.
trans-unit.target: The name of the job can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.

trans-unit.source: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.
trans-unit.target: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a job name that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing job.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a job name that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing job.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing job name, the job definition will be replaced without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing job name, the job definition will be replaced without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Stream Analytics Job][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-job] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Stream Analytics Job][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-job] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command creates a new job from the definition in JobDefinition.json.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command creates a new job from the definition in JobDefinition.json.

trans-unit.source: If an existing job with the name specified in the job definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
trans-unit.target: If an existing job with the name specified in the job definition file is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command replaces the job definition for StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command replaces the job definition for StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput
trans-unit.target: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput

trans-unit.source: Creates a new output within a Stream Analytics job, or updates an existing output.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new output within a Stream Analytics job, or updates an existing output.

trans-unit.source: The name of the output can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.
trans-unit.target: The name of the output can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.

trans-unit.source: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.
trans-unit.target: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an output that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing output.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an output that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing output.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing output name, the output will be replaced without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing output name, the output will be replaced without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Output (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-output] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Output (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-output] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command creates a new output called "output" in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command creates a new output called "output" in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: If an existing output with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
trans-unit.target: If an existing output with this name is already defined, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command replaces the definition for "output" in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command replaces the definition for "output" in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation
trans-unit.target: New-AzureStreamAnalyticsTransformation

trans-unit.source: Creates a new transformation within a Stream Analytics job, or updates the existing transformation.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new transformation within a Stream Analytics job, or updates the existing transformation.

trans-unit.source: The name of the transformation can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.
trans-unit.target: The name of the transformation can be specified in the .json file or on the command line.

trans-unit.source: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.
trans-unit.target: If both are specified, the name on the command line must be the same as the one in the file.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a transformation that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing transformation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a transformation that already exists and do not specify the –Force parameter, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace the existing transformation.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing transformation name, the transformation will be replaced without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter and specify an existing transformation name, the transformation will be replaced without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Transformation (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-transformation] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].
trans-unit.target: For detailed information on the JSON file structure and contents, refer to the [Create Transformation (Azure Stream Analytics)][msdn-rest-api-create-stream-analytics-transformation] section of the [Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference Library][stream.analytics.rest.api.reference].

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command creates a new transformation called StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command creates a new transformation called StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: If an existing transformation is already defined with this name, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.
trans-unit.target: If an existing transformation is already defined with this name, the cmdlet will ask whether or not to replace it.

trans-unit.source: Example 2
trans-unit.target: Example 2

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command replaces the definition of StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command replaces the definition of StreamingJobTransform in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput
trans-unit.target: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously deletes a specific input from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously deletes a specific input from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter, the input will be deleted without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter, the input will be deleted without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command removes the input EventStream in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command removes the input EventStream in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob
trans-unit.target: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously deletes a specific Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously deletes a specific Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter, the job will be deleted without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter, the job will be deleted without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command removes the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command removes the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput
trans-unit.target: Remove-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously deletes a specific output from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously deletes a specific output from a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the –Force parameter, the output will be deleted without confirmation.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the –Force parameter, the output will be deleted without confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command removes the output Output in the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command removes the output Output in the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Start-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob
trans-unit.target: Start-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously deploys and starts a Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command starts the job StreamingJob with a custom output start time set to December 12, 2012, 12:12:12 UTC.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command starts the job StreamingJob with a custom output start time set to December 12, 2012, 12:12:12 UTC.

trans-unit.source: Stop-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob
trans-unit.target: Stop-AzureStreamAnalyticsJob

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously stops a Stream Analytics job from running in Microsoft Azure and de-allocates resources that were that were being used.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously stops a Stream Analytics job from running in Microsoft Azure and de-allocates resources that were that were being used.

trans-unit.source: The job definition and metadata will remain available within your subscription through both the Azure portal and management APIs, such that the job can be edited and restarted.
trans-unit.target: The job definition and metadata will remain available within your subscription through both the Azure portal and management APIs, such that the job can be edited and restarted.

trans-unit.source: You will not be charged for a job in the stopped state.
trans-unit.target: You will not be charged for a job in the stopped state.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command stops the job StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command stops the job StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput
trans-unit.target: Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsInput

trans-unit.source: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified input.
trans-unit.target: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified input.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command tests the connection status of the input EntryStream in StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command tests the connection status of the input EntryStream in StreamingJob.

trans-unit.source: Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput
trans-unit.target: Test-AzureStreamAnalyticsOutput

trans-unit.source: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified output.
trans-unit.target: Tests the ability of Stream Analytics to connect to a specified output.

trans-unit.source: Example 1
trans-unit.target: Example 1

trans-unit.source: This PowerShell command tests the connection status of the output Output in StreamingJob.
trans-unit.target: This PowerShell command tests the connection status of the output Output in StreamingJob.
